TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ProcessModelComImpersonationLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the authentication level for COM security.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ProcessModelComImpersonationLevel class enumerates the values to use when you set the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection.ComImpersonationLevel%2A> property.
The default value is Impersonate.
## Examples The following code example shows how to access the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection.ComImpersonationLevel%2A> property.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection#22](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.web.configurati_52_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection#22](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.web.configurati_52_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComImpersonationLevel Anonymous = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the client is anonymous to the server. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The server can impersonate the client, but the impersonation token will not contain any information.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComImpersonationLevel Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies that DCOM determines the impersonation level. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks DCOM determines the impersonation level, using its normal security-negotiation algorithm.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComImpersonationLevel Delegate = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the server process can impersonate the client's security context while acting on behalf of the client. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The server process can make outgoing calls to other servers while acting on behalf of the client, using cloaking. The server can use the client's security context on other computers to access local and remote resources as the client. When the process is impersonating the client at this level, the impersonation token can be passed across any number of computer boundaries.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComImpersonationLevel Identify = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the server can obtain the client's identity. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The server can impersonate the client for access control list (ACL) checking, but it cannot access system objects as the client.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComImpersonationLevel Impersonate = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the server process can impersonate the client's security context while acting on behalf of the client. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This level of impersonation can be used to access local resources such as files. When the process is impersonating the client at this level, the impersonation token can be passed across only one computer boundary.
